title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of love, loss, and the American Dream set in the Jazz Age.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling vision of a totalitarian future where individuality is suppressed.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A coming-of-age story set in the American South during the Great Depression, exploring themes of racism and justice.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A witty and romantic novel about love, class, and societal expectations in 19th-century England.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic tale of obsession and the sea, as Captain Ahab pursues the white whale.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A coming-of-age novel about a troubled teenager's alienation and disillusionment with society.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A classic fantasy adventure following a hobbit's journey to reclaim a stolen treasure.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian novel exploring the dangers of censorship and the power of books.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An epic poem chronicling Odysseus's ten-year journey home after the Trojan War.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A panoramic novel depicting Russian society during the Napoleonic Wars.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian satire exploring a future society where happiness is engineered and individuality is suppressed.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte BrontÃ«
description: A Gothic romance novel about a young orphan's journey to self-discovery and love.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological thriller exploring themes of guilt, redemption, and the nature of morality.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A philosophical novel exploring the consequences of hedonism and the corrupting influence of beauty.

title: The Diary of a Young Girl
author: Anne Frank
description: A poignant memoir chronicling the life of a young Jewish girl hiding from the Nazis during World War II.
